required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sintilimab and Nimotuzumab Combined With Chemotherapy for the Treatment of R/M HNSCC.
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Single-arm Study of Sintilimab and Nimotuzumab Combined With Chemotherapy for the Treatment of Recurrent/Metastatic Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

brief_summary.textblock: This clinical study is designed as a prospective, open-label, single arm, multicenter study to evaluate the clinical efficacy and safety of Sintilimab and Nimotuzumab in combination with chemotherapy in patients with newly diagnosed recurrent/metastatic head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (R/M HNSCC). The main endpoint is progression free survival (PFS); the secondary endpoint are objective response rate (ORR), disease control rate (DCR), overall survival (OS) and safety.

other_outcome.description: To evaluate the relationship between tumor biomarkers (including but not limited to EGFR or PD-L1 expression, TILs, TMB, HPV status, P16 expression, etc.) and prognosis.

clinical_study.condition: Recurrent/Metastatic Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma

intervention.description: Nimotuzumab, 400mg, intravenously every 3 weeks, for at least 18 weeks
Sintilimab, 200mg, intravenously every 3 weeks, for at least 18 weeks;
Chemotherapy drugs were selected by the investigator, every 3 weeks, for 18 weeks

condition_browse.mesh_term: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck
